issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.summary: TestDataNodeMetrics failing intermittently due to TotalWriteTime counted incorrectly

comments.body: Attach a simple patch from me. I also bump the timeout time in patch to avoid that the test executed on a busy jenkins slave, kindly review.

This message was automatically generated.
Good analysis! I think a better way to do this is to use a real FSDataset? Just remove {{SimulatedFSDataset.setFactory(conf);}}. What do you think ?
Hi, [~walter.k.su], I have removed {{SimulatedFSDataset.setFactory(conf);}} in my patch, do you means there is no need to bump the timeout time in addition?
sorry I didn't see that. The patch LGTM. +1.
Committed to trunk, branch-2, branch-2.8, branch-2.7. Thanks [~linyiqun] for the contribution!

FAILURE: Integrated in Hadoop-trunk-Commit #9626 (See [https://builds.apache.org/job/Hadoop-trunk-Commit/9626/])
HDFS-10275. TestDataNodeMetrics failing intermittently due to (waltersu4549: rev ab903029a9d353677184ff5602966b11ffb408b9)
* hadoop-hdfs-project/hadoop-hdfs/src/test/java/org/apache/hadoop/hdfs/server/datanode/TestDataNodeMetrics.java
Closing the JIRA as part of 2.7.3 release.
